Estimate soil specific heat

Source: R/TsoilFunctions.R
soil_specific_heat.Rd

estimate soil specific heat in J kg^-1 K^-1 using the methods of de Vries (1963, The Physics of Plant Environments, Ch2 in Environmental Control of Plant Growth). Uses the volume fraction of organic material, minerals, and water in soil. CHECK Campbell and Norman (2000) section 8.2.

soil_specific_heat(x_o, x_m, x_w, rho_so)

Arguments

x_o

is volume fraction of organic material

x_m

is volume fraction of minerals

x_w

is volume fraction of water

rho_so

is particle density of soil in kg/m^3 (bulk density)

Value

soil specific heat (J kg^-1 K^-1)

See also

Other soil temperature functions: soil_conductivity(), soil_temperature_equation(), soil_temperature_function(), soil_temperature_integrand(), soil_temperature()

Author

Joseph Grigg

Examples

soil_specific_heat(x_o=0.01, x_m=0.6, x_w=0.2, rho_so=1620)
#> [1] 869.2968
